MEASURE: Health screenings in airports and border crossings

COMMENTS: Nevruz festival cancelled
Closure of borders with Iran
all public gatherings banned
Food imports from Iran and Afghanistan has been limited
All China and Iran nationals
MoPH begins announcements on their facebook to make public aware of coronavirus.

MEASURE: Health screenings in airports and border crossings
COMMENTS: Health teams at airports will check passengers coming from China.
Flights to China are suspended.

MEASURE: Health screenings in airports and border crossings
COMMENTS: Health screenings of all passengers at airports.

Print, publishing and sending advertising materials about health services. Publishing messages in hospitals, building video guidance at ports of entry, making a clear part of the passengers's location, creating a clear section on the ministry's website to publish the content related to coronavirus.
the launch of education programs for doctors to handle COVID-19
Established specific areas for quarantine in Kabul and in the provinces for the control of COVID-19
Avoid domestic travel to the Herat province.
Awareness campaign expands to include avoiding kissing, weddings, meetings, funerals, and other social luxuries.
Increased the screened teams on the ground and air border, especially the provinces of the border with Iran to identify the people with this virus (Midday Province).
New awareness campaign to “prevent the spread of coronavirus”
School closures until "the end of the month" (Afghanistan uses the Solar Hijri calendar)

MEASURE: Health screenings in airports and border crossings
COMMENTS: Installed new heat censor machines to detect fever at passengers coming through ports of entry into the country and ports into and out of Herat Province (the epicenter of the outbreak in Afghanistan, at this point in time).
People should avoid official and non-official protests (gatherings?) to prevent the spread of coronavirus.

The Afghan Ministries of Public Health and Interior jointly announced that the city of Kabul would be placed on lockdown for 21 days due to spread of the COVID-19 coronavirus. Residents may only move outside their homes to obtain essential food and medicine; and provide caregiving. According to the government, vehicles carrying more than four passengers, as well as buses, are prohibited from traveling in and out of Kabul.
Releases Hundreds of Prisoners to Limit Coronavirus Outbreaks
international flight suspension
General hygiene campaign
SOURCE: Ministry of Public Health of Afghanistan

COMMENTS: The Government of Afghanistan has re-opened its border with Iran, which had been closed briefly to all air and ground travel.
